channel.title: BBC News - Europe

item.title: Nord Stream 2: US and Germany reach deal on controversial Russian gas pipeline
item.description: The US says the agreement prevents Russia from using the pipeline as a political weapon over Europe.

item.title: 'I survived Norway's worst terror attack'
item.description: Lisa Husby recalls hiding in fear as far-right extremist Anders Breivik went on a killing spree in a summer camp for young activists on Utøya island on 22 July 2011.

item.title: Soldier statue reignites Spanish row over fascism
item.description: Spain's legionnaires symbolised fascism, but Madrid may soon have a statue honouring them.

item.title: British man arrested in Spain over Twitter hack
item.description: The 2020 attack on a series of celebrity accounts targeted Elon Musk and Barack Obama, among others.

item.title: Gold toilet found in Russian police bribery probe
item.description: Investigators show video of a palatial villa, accusing traffic police of a mafia-style racket.

item.title: UK defends latest Channel crossings deal
item.description: The government is paying France £54m in a bid to stem the number of migrants travelling to the UK.

item.title: Liverpool stripped of Unesco World Heritage status
item.description: The city is deleted from the much-coveted Unesco list because of developments on the waterfront.

item.title: Brexit: UK wants to redraw Northern Ireland Protocol
item.description: Lord Frost says the Northern Ireland Protocol is tearing the UK's "fabric" - but the EU won't renegotiate.

item.title: Russia sends long-delayed module to space station
item.description: The 13m-long, 20-tonne Nauka laboratory is finally going into orbit after a delay of 14 years.

item.title: Tokyo Olympics: Sweden stun USA in women's football opener
item.description: Sweden's women's football team stun world champions the United States in their opening match at the Olympic Games in Tokyo.

item.title: Covid: France rolls out health pass as cases soar
item.description: From Wednesday people will need proof of vaccination or a negative test to access some public places.

item.title: UK clashes with EU over Gibraltar's post-Brexit status
item.description: Foreign Secretary Dominic Raab says a draft EU mandate undermines UK sovereignty over the territory.

item.title: Pegasus: French President Macron identified as spyware target
item.description: The president's phone number was found on a list of numbers that were potential phone hacking targets.

item.title: In pictures: Germany grapples with flood aftermath
item.description: A massive clean-up is under way, but Germany's flood damage won't be fixed for many months.

item.title: Beta coronavirus variant: What is the risk?
item.description: There are fears that this version of coronavirus, first identified in South Africa, is

item.title: 'Jurassic Pompeii' yields thousands of 'squiggly wiggly' fossils
item.description: Scientists are excavating one of the most important Jurassic sites ever discovered in the UK.

item.title: Heatwaves: What do they do to the body and who is at risk?
item.description: What impact do high temperatures have on our bodies?

item.title: Pegasus: Who are the alleged victims of spyware targeting?
item.description: Jamal Khashoggi's wife and the editor of the Financial Times are among those said to be targeted.

item.title: What are the travel rules for Spain, Portugal, Malta and other holiday hotspots?
item.description: What you need to know about going to Portugal, Spain, Greece, France, Malta, Italy and Turkey.

item.title: Europe floods: 'I have an axe beside my bed'
item.description: Marion Wenzel showed the BBC around her flood-wrecked house in Ahrweiler, Germany.

item.title: First space tourist Dennis Tito: 'I was euphoric'
item.description: Dennis Tito paid $20 million to travel to the International Space Station in 2001.

item.title: Horse racing: Inside the abattoir slaughtering racehorses
item.description: Campaign group Animal Aid set up covert cameras in one of the few slaughterhouses licensed to kill horses.

item.title: Europe floods: Residents return home to see damage inflicted
item.description: Resident in Kleivelderweg, deep inside the Dutch disaster zone, find homes and businesses destroyed.

item.title: Drone footage shows flood damage in Germany and Belgium
item.description: At least 120 people have died and hundreds more are unaccounted for in western Europe.
